Name: Absorb
Effect: A GRASS-type attack. It adds half the HP it drained from the target to the attacker's HP.

Name: Acid
Effect: A POISON-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of lowering the target's DEFENSE.

Name: Acid Armor
Effect: Melts the user's body for protection. A move that sharply raises DEFENSE.

Name: Agility
Effect: A special technique that greatly boosts the user's SPEED. Can normally be used up to three times.

Name: Amnesia
Effect: Sharply raises the user's SPECIAL stat. Also increases protection against special attacks.

Name: Aurora Beam
Effect: An ICE-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of reducing the target's ATTACK power.

Name: Barrage
Effect: Several spheres are thrown consecutively at the target to inflict damage.

Name: Barrier
Effect: Instantly forms a barrier between the user and the opponent. DEFENSE is sharply increased.

Name: Bide
Effect: The user waits for several turns. At the end, it returns double the damage it received.

Name: Bind
Effect: Traps and squeezes the target over several turns. The target cannot move while under attack.

Name: Bite
Effect: A bite made using sharp fangs. This may cause the opponent to flinch, and it might not attack.

Name: Blizzard
Effect: The strongest ICE-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of freezing the target solid.

Name: Body Slam
Effect: A NORMAL-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of paralyzing the target if it connects.

Name: Bone Club
Effect: A physical attack using a bone as a club. If it connects, it may cause the target to flinch.

Name: Bonemerang
Effect: A boomerang made of bone is thrown to inflict damage twice -- on the way out and on its return.

Name: Bubble
Effect: A WATER-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of reducing the target's SPEED.

Name: Bubble Beam
Effect: A WATER-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of reducing the target's SPEED.

Name: Clamp
Effect: The target is gripped in the attacker's shell for two to five turns. It can't move while under attack.

Name: Comet Punch
Effect: Although each slap is weak, this attack hits the target two to five times in succession.

Name: Confuse Ray
Effect: A sinister flash of light makes the target confused. A special GHOST-type technique.

Name: Confusion
Effect: A PSYCHIC-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of leaving the target confused.

Name: Constrict
Effect: A NORMAL-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of reducing the target's SPEED.

Name: Conversion
Effect: A special move that switches the user's elemental type to that of the target.

Name: Counter
Effect: A retaliation move that pays back double the damage of a physical attack. Highly accurate.

Name: Counter
Effect: A retaliation move that pays back double the damage of a physical attack. Highly accurate.

Name: Crabhammer
Effect: A move that is used only by Pokémon with pincers. Likely to get a critical hit.

Name: Cut
Effect: A NORMAL-type attack. Also used for cutting small bushes to open new paths.

Name: Defense Curl
Effect: Raises the user's DEFENSE. Can normally be used up to six times in a row.

Name: Dig
Effect: The attacker digs underground in the first turn, then pops up in the next turn to attack.

Name: Disable
Effect: A technique that disables one of the target's moves. The disabled move can't be used until it wears off.

Name: Dizzy Punch
Effect: A NORMAL-type attack. The punch is relatively strong and highly accurate.

Name: Double Kick
Effect: A FIGHTING-type attack. As the name implies, it is actually two quick kicks in succession.

Name: Double Kick
Effect: A FIGHTING-type attack. As the name implies, it is actually two quick kicks in succession.

Name: Double Slap
Effect: Although each slap is weak, this attack hits the target two to five times in succession.

Name: Double Team
Effect: Creates illusionary copies of the user. The copies disorient the enemy, reducing its accuracy.

Name: Double-Edge
Effect: A charging tackle attack. One quarter of the damage it inflicts comes back to hurt the attacker.

Name: Dragon Rage
Effect: A DRAGON-type attack. It inflicts a set amount of damage, regardless of the target's type.

Name: Dream Eater
Effect: Works only on sleeping Pokémon. This technique steals the target's HP and adds it to the user's HP.

Name: Drill Peck
Effect: A standard FLYING-type attack. It is strong and highly likely to hit the target.

Name: Earthquake
Effect: An attack that inflicts damage by shaking the ground. It is useless against FLYING-type Pokémon.

Name: Egg Bomb
Effect: A NORMAL-type attack. An egg is launched at the target. It may miss, however.

Name: Ember
Effect: A FIRE-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of leaving the target with a damaging burn.

Name: Explosion
Effect: The most powerful attack of all. However, the attacker faints after using this move.

Name: Fire Blast
Effect: The strongest FIRE-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of inflicting a burn on the target.

Name: Fire Punch
Effect: A special FIRE-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of inflicting a burn on the target.

Name: Fire Spin
Effect: A FIRE-type attack that lasts two to five turns. The target cannot move while surrounded by flames.

Name: Fissure
Effect: Causes a single-hit knockout if it hits. Useless against FLYING-type Pokémon.

Name: Flamethrower
Effect: A powerful FIRE-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of leaving the target with a damaging burn.

Name: Flash
Effect: Creates a brilliant flash of light that blinds the target. This technique reduces the opponent's accuracy.

Name: Fly
Effect: The Pokémon flies high, then strikes in the next turn. Used for flying to places already visited.

Name: Focus Energy
Effect: Raises the likelihood of nailing the opponent's weak spot for a critical hit.

Name: Fury Attack
Effect: A NORMAL-type attack. The Pokémon rapidly jabs at its opponent several times.

Name: Fury Swipes
Effect: The target is scratched by sharp claws two to five times in quick succession.

Name: Glare
Effect: The target is transfixed with terrifying sharp eyes. The target is frightened into paralysis.

Name: Growl
Effect: A technique that lowers the target's ATTACK power. Can normally be used up to six times.

Name: Growth
Effect: Raises SPECIAL to make special attacks stronger and enhance protection against special moves.

Name: Guillotine
Effect: A single-hit knockout attack. Learned only by Pokémon that have large pincers.

Name: Gust
Effect: A NORMAL-type attack used by bird Pokémon. A powerful wind is generated by flapping wings.

Name: Harden
Effect: Raises the user's DEFENSE. Useful when battling physically strong Pokémon.

Name: Haze
Effect: Eliminates all changes affecting status, such as SPEED and accuracy, of both Pokémon in battle.

Name: Headbutt
Effect: A NORMAL-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of making the target flinch if it connects.

Name: Hi Jump Kick
Effect: Stronger than a JUMP KICK. If it misses, the attacker sustains 1/8 the damage it should have caused.

Name: Hi Jump Kick
Effect: Stronger than a JUMP KICK. If it misses, the attacker sustains 1/8 the damage it should have caused.

Name: Horn Attack
Effect: A NORMAL-type attack. A sharp horn is driven hard into the target to inflict damage.

Name: Horn Drill
Effect: A single-hit knockout attack. Learned only by Pokémon with a horn or horns.

Name: Hydro Pump
Effect: The strongest WATER-type attack. However, while it is powerful, it may miss the target.

Name: Hyper Beam
Effect: An extremely powerful attack. The attacker becomes so tired, it has to rest the next turn.

Name: Hyper Fang
Effect: A NORMAL-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of making the target flinch.

Name: Hypnosis
Effect: A special PSYCHIC-type move. The target is hypnotized into a deep sleep.

Name: Ice Beam
Effect: An ICE-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of freezing the target solid.

Name: Ice Punch
Effect: A special ICE-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of freezing the target.

Name: Jump Kick
Effect: A forceful FIGHTING-type attack. If it misses, however, the attacker gets hurt.

Name: Jump Kick
Effect: A forceful FIGHTING-type attack. If it misses, however, the attacker gets hurt.

Name: Karate Chop
Effect: A NORMAL-type attack. Often turns into a critical hit and inflicts double the damage.

Name: Kinesis
Effect: A special move of bending spoons to confound the enemy. Makes the user harder to hit.

Name: Leech Life
Effect: An HP-draining attack. It adds half the HP it drained from the target to the attacker's HP.

Name: Leech Seed
Effect: Plants a seed on the target Pokémon. The seed slowly drains the target's HP for the attacker.

Name: Leer
Effect: A technique that lowers the target's DEFENSE. Useful against tough, armored Pokémon.

Name: Lick
Effect: A GHOST-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of leaving the target with paralysis.

Name: Light Screen
Effect: Reduces damage from special attacks by about half. A special PSYCHIC-type technique.

Name: Lovely Kiss
Effect: A special move that puts the target to sleep with a big kiss. (Actually, the victim passes out.)

Name: Low Kick
Effect: A FIGHTING-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of making the target flinch if it connects.

Name: Low Kick
Effect: A FIGHTING-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of making the target flinch if it connects.

Name: Meditate
Effect: A special technique that boosts the user's ATTACK power. Can normally be used up to six times.

Name: Mega Drain
Effect: A GRASS-type attack. It adds half the HP it drained from the target to the attacker's HP.

Name: Mega Kick
Effect: A NORMAL-type attack. Out of all the Pokémon kicking attacks, this is the strongest.

Name: Mega Punch
Effect: A NORMAL-type attack move. It is highly accurate and relatively powerful.

Name: Metronome
Effect: The user waggles its finger, triggering a move. There is no telling what will happen.

Name: Mimic
Effect: A move for learning one of the opponent's moves, for use during that battle only.

Name: Minimize
Effect: Reduces the user's size and makes it harder to hit. Can normally be used up to six times.

Name: Mirror Move
Effect: A move that strikes back with the opponent's last move. This move comes after the enemy's move.

Name: Mist
Effect: Provides full protection against any enemy status attack, such as those that lower DEFENSE.

Name: Night Shade
Effect: A GHOST-type attack. Highly accurate, it inflicts damage regardless of the target's type.

Name: Pay Day
Effect: A move that also nets money at the end of battle. How much depends on the attack frequency and level.

Name: Peck
Effect: A standard FLYING-type attack. It is favored by Pokémon that have beaks and/or horns.

Name: Petal Dance
Effect: A dance-like attack that lasts two to three turns. Afterwards, the attacker becomes confused.

Name: Pin Missile
Effect: An attack that fires many needle-like projectiles from the body. Strikes several times.

Name: Poison Gas
Effect: A poisonous cloud of gas is forcefully expelled to poison the target.

Name: Poison Powder
Effect: A technique that poisons the target. If poisoned, the victim loses HP steadily.

Name: Poison Sting
Effect: A POISON-type attack. Has a one-in- five chance of leaving the target with the lingering effects of poison.

Name: Pound
Effect: A NORMAL-type attack. Slightly stronger than TACKLE. Many Pokémon know this move.

Name: Psybeam
Effect: A PSYCHIC-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of making the target confused.

Name: Psychic
Effect: A PSYCHIC-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of lowering the target's SPECIAL rating.

Name: Psywave
Effect: A PSYCHIC-type attack of varying intensity. It occasionally inflicts heavy damage.

Name: Quick Attack
Effect: An attack that always strikes first. If both Pokémon use this, the one with higher SPEED attacks first.

Name: Rage
Effect: A non-stop attack move. The user's ATTACK power increases every time it sustains damage.

Name: Razor Leaf
Effect: A GRASS-type attack that sends sharp-edged leaves at the target. Likely to get a critical hit.

Name: Razor Wind
Effect: A two-turn attack with the wind attack in the second turn. Learned by many FLYING-type Pokémon.

Name: Recover
Effect: Restores HP by 1/2 of the user's maximum HP. Few Pokémon learn this technique on their own.

Name: Reflect
Effect: Reduces damage from physical attacks by about half. A special PSYCHIC-type technique.

Name: Rest
Effect: The user takes a nap to fully restore its HP and recover from any status abnormalities.

Name: Roar
Effect: A terrifying roar that drives wild Pokémon away. It is useful only in the wild.

Name: Rock Slide
Effect: A ROCK-type attack that hits the target with an avalanche of rocks and boulders.

Name: Rock Throw
Effect: A ROCK-type attack. As the name implies, a huge boulder is dropped on the target.

Name: Rolling Kick
Effect: A sharp FIGHTING-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of making the target flinch if it connects.

Name: Rolling Kick
Effect: A sharp FIGHTING-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of making the target flinch if it connects.

Name: Sand-Attack
Effect: An attack in which sand is used to blind the target and reduce its attack accuracy.

Name: Scratch
Effect: A NORMAL-type attack. Sharp claws are used to inflict damage on the target.

Name: Screech
Effect: A move that makes a horrible noise. It sharply reduces the target's DEFENSE.

Name: Seismic Toss
Effect: A FIGHTING-type attack. Throws the target with enough force to flip the world upside down.

Name: Seismic Toss
Effect: A FIGHTING-type attack. Throws the target with enough force to flip the world upside down.

Name: Self-Destruct
Effect: The user explodes, inflicting damage on the enemy, then faints. Useless against GHOST-type.

Name: Sharpen
Effect: Raises the user's ATTACK power. The edges of the Pokémon are made harder for more impact.

Name: Sing
Effect: A special NORMAL-type technique. A soothing melody lulls the target to sleep.

Name: Skull Bash
Effect: In the first turn, the attacker tucks in its head. The next turn, it head-butts at full steam.

Name: Sky Attack
Effect: The strongest FLYING-type attack. Energy is stored in the first turn, then fired the next turn.

Name: Slam
Effect: A NORMAL-type attack move. The attacker uses an appendage (e.g. tail) to slam the target hard.

Name: Slash
Effect: A NORMAL-type attack. It has a high probability of a critical hit for inflicting double the damage.

Name: Sleep Powder
Effect: Induces sleep. A Pokémon will stay asleep for several turns if an item isn't used to wake it.

Name: Sludge
Effect: A POISON-type attack. Has a fifty-fifty chance of poisoning the target.

Name: Smog
Effect: Smog is spewed as a cloud. Has a fifty-fifty chance of poisoning the target.

Name: Smokescreen
Effect: Creates an obscuring cloud of smoke that reduces the enemy's accuracy.

Name: Soft-Boiled
Effect: Restores HP by 1/2 of the user's maximum HP. May also be used in the field.

Name: Solar Beam
Effect: The strongest GRASS-type attack. Energy is absorbed in the first turn, then fired the next turn.

Name: Sonic Boom
Effect: A NORMAL-type attack. It inflicts a set amount of damage regardless of the target's type.

Name: Spike Cannon
Effect: A physical attack consisting of two to five consecutive hits. Highly accurate.

Name: Splash
Effect: A move that involves only flopping and SPLASHing around in front of the opponent. It has no effect.

Name: Spore
Effect: Special spores are scattered from mushrooms. If the opponent inhales the spores, it will fall asleep.

Name: Stomp
Effect: A NORMAL-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of making the target flinch if it connects.

Name: Strength
Effect: A very powerful NORMAL-type attack. Also used for moving obstacles like boulders.

Name: String Shot
Effect: Strings are sprayed out and wrapped around the target to reduce its SPEED.

Name: Struggle
Effect: Used only if the user runs totally out of PP. The user is hit with 1/4 of the damage it inflicts.

Name: Stun Spore
Effect: A special move that causes paralysis. When paralyzed, the victim has a one-in-four chance of immobility.

Name: Submission
Effect: The strongest FIGHTING attack. One quarter of the damage it inflicts comes back to hurt the attacker.

Name: Submission
Effect: The strongest FIGHTING attack. One quarter of the damage it inflicts comes back to hurt the attacker.

Name: Substitute
Effect: Uses 1/4 of the user's maximum HP to create a substitute that takes the opponent's attacks.

Name: Super Fang
Effect: If it hits, this attack cuts the target's HP in half. Learned by Pokémon with developed fangs.

Name: Supersonic
Effect: A special NORMAL-type technique. Supersonic sound waves are used to confuse the target.

Name: Surf
Effect: A WATER-type attack. The power of this technique is strong and highly accurate.

Name: Swift
Effect: A NORMAL-type attack. It is highly accurate, so it can be counted on to inflict damage.

Name: Swords Dance
Effect: A special move that greatly boosts the user's ATTACK power. Can normally be used up to three times.

Name: Tackle
Effect: A NORMAL-type attack. Many Pokémon know this attack right from the start.

Name: Tail Whip
Effect: A technique that lowers the target's DEFENSE. Useful against tough, armored Pokémon.

Name: Take Down
Effect: A charging attack. One quarter of the damage it inflicts comes back to hurt the attacker.

Name: Teleport
Effect: A special technique for instantly escaping from wild Pokémon. Useful in the wild only.

Name: Thrash
Effect: An attack that lasts two to three turns. Afterwards, the attacker becomes confused.

Name: Thunder
Effect: The strongest of all ELECTRIC-type attacks. Has a one-in-ten chance of paralyzing the target.

Name: Thunder Punch
Effect: A special ELECTRIC-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of paralyzing the target.

Name: Thunder Shock
Effect: An ELECTRIC-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of paralyzing the target.

Name: Thunder Wave
Effect: A special move that causes paralysis. When paralyzed, the victim has a one-in-four chance of immobility.

Name: Thunderbolt
Effect: An ELECTRIC-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of paralyzing the target.

Name: Toxic
Effect: A technique that badly poisons the target. The amount of damage from the poison increases every turn.

Name: Transform
Effect: Transforms the user into a copy of the target, including the type. All moves have only five PP each.

Name: Tri Attack
Effect: A NORMAL-type attack. A triangular field of energy is created and launched at the target.

Name: Twineedle
Effect: An attack that strikes twice. The target may occasionally become poisoned.

Name: Vice Grip
Effect: A NORMAL-type attack used only by Pokémon with pincers. The target is gripped and injured.

Name: Vine Whip
Effect: A GRASS-type attack. The Pokémon uses its cruel whips to strike the opponent.

Name: Water Gun
Effect: A WATER-type attack. Stronger than BUBBLE. Many WATER-type Pokémon learn this move.

Name: Waterfall
Effect: A WATER-type attack. The target is hit with a blow packing the power of fish traveling up waterfalls.

Name: Whirlwind
Effect: Generates a powerful wind that blows away wild Pokémon. Useful in the wild only.

Name: Wing Attack
Effect: A FLYING-type attack. The attacking Pokémon spreads its wings and charges at the target.

Name: Withdraw
Effect: Used mainly by Pokémon with shells. By withdrawing into the shell, DEFENSE is increased.

Name: Wrap
Effect: Traps and squeezes the target over two to five turns. The target cannot move while under attack.
